name: dubitable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
possible to doubt; possibly not true, accurate, or real: The witnesses are unreliable and the evidence is now dubitable. These so-called experts sometimes have dubitable qualifications. Opposite
indubitableRelated word
doubtCompare
doubtful
dubious
More examplesFewer examplesTheir beliefs about the world rely on dubitable information.It seems dubitable that he would have made a speech like that.He was able to show that these beliefs were dubitable.The lawyers need to exclude any evidence that is in any way dubitable.These figures may be dubitable because people make errors in calculating.
